http://news.sky.com/story/illegal-referendum-gets-under-way-in-catalonia-amid-fears-of-violence-11062371

By Mark Stone, Europe Correspondent in Barcelona, and Daniel Cairns, News Reporter

Riot police have pushed back voters at some polling stations in Catalonia as an illegal independence referendum gets under way in the Spanish region.

Officers in helmets faced off against chanting crowds and there were scuffles in Girona, with some people waving their ballot papers in the air.

Guardia Civil police in the northeastern city used a hammer to smash their way into one polling station.

But Sky's Europe Correspondent Mark Stone, in Catalan capital Barcelona, said the situation was so far remaining peaceful there.

Catalan officials have said voters can go to any polling station, not just their designated one, in an attempt to ensure people can vote if their local one is shut down.

On the orders of the central government in Madrid, thousands of national police have been drafted in to shut down the polling stations.
